Right after that, I realize I've just missed something, as if a piece of a jigsaw puzzle has vanished into thin air, leaving me staring at the empty space. It's like my brain sometimes falls asleep, and before I know it, I've missed something, as if a piece of the puzzle called the universe has fallen out and I'm staring at the empty space left behind. vi_translation: I am fairly certain that I am on the northern shore of Long Island. Because from here, I can see the valley stretching out to the coast. The sparkling sea is about two kilometers away from the house. I couldn't believe my eyes when I gazed at the scenery from here to there. Scattered across the open land are buildings constructed in the ancient Greek style: a pavilion in the middle of the field, an amphitheater, and a circular arena. Only thing is, they all look very new. The stone columns gleam under the bright sunlight. In a nearby large sandpit, about a dozen teenagers are playing volleyball with forest spirits. On the small lake, a few motorboats are circling around. Over there, students wearing orange T-shirts similar to Grover's are chasing each other and playing around the wooden cabins hidden in the sparse forest. I also see some targets for archery practice. In the distance, a few people are riding horses down the trail. I must be hallucinating because I see some of the horses even have wings.
tr_translation: We must have been on the north shore of Long Island because the valley extended to the sea on this side of the house. The sea was sparkling brightly a kilometer and a half away. I was having difficulty perceiving everything I saw in the distance. Here and there, there were structures resembling ancient Greek architecture: an open-air pavilion, an amphitheater, a circular arena. But they were all brand new, with white marble columns gleaming in the sunlight. On a nearby sandy field, a dozen high school-aged kids and satyrs were playing volleyball. Canoes were gliding on a tiny lake. Kids wearing bright orange T-shirts similar to what Curly was wearing were lined up in the groves, chasing each other among clusters of cabins. Some were shooting arrows at targets in the archery range. Others were riding horses on a path surrounded by trees, and if I wasn't hallucinating, some of the horses had wings.
es_translation: We must have been on the north shore of Long Island because on that side of the house the valley merged with the water, which sparkled along the coast. What I saw surprised me greatly. The landscape was dotted with buildings that looked like ancient Greek architecture ‚Äîan open-air pavilion, an amphitheater, a sand arena‚Äî but they appeared newly built, with the white marble columns gleaming in the sun. On a nearby sand court, there were a dozen kids and satyrs playing volleyball. Beyond that, some canoes were gliding across a nearby lake. There were children dressed in orange T-shirts like Grover's, chasing each other around a group of cabins among the trees. Some were shooting arrows at targets. Others were riding horses along a wooded trail and, unless I was hallucinating, some of the mounts had wings.
st: Re tlameha ebe re ne re le lebopong le ka leboea la Long Island, hobane ka lehlakoreng lena la ntlo, phula e ile ea tsamaea ka tsela eohle ho ea metsing, e neng e phatsima hoo e ka bang lik'hilomithara hole. Pakeng tsa mona le mane, ke ne ke sa khone ho sebetsana le ntho e ngoe le e ngoe eo ke e bonang. Sebaka sa naha se ne se na le meaho e neng e shebahala joaloka mehaho ea boholo-holo ea Greece-e bulehileng, amphitheater, lebaleng le chitja-ntle le hore kaofela ba ne ba shebahala ba le lecha, likholomo tsa bona tse t≈°oeu tsa 'mabole tse phatsimang letsatsing. Ka har'a sandpit e haufi, bana ba lilemo li leshome le metso e 'meli ba sekolo se phahameng le satyrs ba ne ba bapala le volleyball. Li-canodes li ile tsa t≈°ela let≈°eng le lenyenyane. Bana ba apereng li-t-shirts tse khanyang tsa lamunu joalo ka Grover ba ne ba lelekisana le sehlopha sa likamore tse nang le libaka tse koahetsoeng ka morung. Tse ling tsa tsona li na le li-10 tse nang le li-archery. Ba bang ba palama lipere tseleng ea lehong, 'me, ntle le hore ke hallucinating, tse ling tsa lipere tsa bona li ne li e-na le mapheo.

tn: Re tshwanetse ra bo re le kwa bokone jwa Setlhaketlhake sa Long Island, ka gonne mo letlhakoreng leno la ntlo, noka e ne ya tsamaya ka tsela yotlhe go ya kwa metsing, e e neng ya phatsima sekgala se se ka nnang sekgala se seleele. Fa ke le koo, ke ne ke sa kgone go dira sengwe le sengwe se ke se bonang. Lefelo le ne le na le dikago tse di neng di lebega jaaka dikago tsa bogologolo tsa Segerika- lefelo le le bulegileng le le bulegileng, lefelo le le dikologang le le dikologang ntle le gore botlhe ba ne ba lebega ba le molelo o mosha, diphefo tsa bone tsa mmala o mosweu o o phatsimang mo letsatsing. Fa go ne go na le bana ba le bantsi ba ba neng ba le mo sekolong se se kwa godimo, ba ne ba tshameka metshameko e le lesome le bofitlha. Letsha le lennye le ne le tsamaya mo letsheng le lennye. Bana ba ba nang le di-orange t-shirts tse di tshwanang le Tsa Grover ba ne ba feretlhela di-cabins tse neng di le mo sekgweng. Some potshots at a potshots at a archery. Ba bangwe ba ne ba palama dipitse, mme fa ke sa na le diphuka, dipitse tse dingwe tsa bone di ne di na le diphuka.

ty: E tia ia matou ia haere na te pae apatoerau o te motu Long Island, no te mea i teie pae o te fare, ua haere te peho e tae roa ' tu i te pape, o te anaana ra fatata ho√™ kilometera i te atea. I rotopu i tera e tera vahi, aita ta'u e nehenehe e taui i te mau mea atoa ta'u e ite ra. Ua √Æ roa te fenua i te mau fare e au i te mau fare tahito no te fenua Heleni, te ho√™ tahua ha'utiraa teata taata ora, te ho√™ tahua tu'eraa popo, e au ra e mea ap√Æ ratou paatoa, to ratou mau pou uouo e anaana ra i ni'a i te mahana. I roto i te ho√™ fare inuraa one i piha'i iho noa mai, ua ha'uti ho√™ tatini tamarii haere haapiiraa tuarua e te tahi mau taata ha'uti i te volleyball. Ua tere te mau vaa na roto i te ho√™ roto iti. Te tapapa ra te mau tamarii e ahu anani anaana to ratou mai to Grover te tahi i te tahi na roto i te ho√™ anairaa ofaaraa i roto i te uru raau. Ua pupuhi vetahi i te mau tapao i nia i te ho√™ anairaa ofai pupuhi. Area te tahi pae ra, e tere √Øa na ni'a i te puaahorofenua na ni'a i te ho√™ e'a raau, e mai te mea e, aita vau e faahoro, e pererau to te tahi o ta ratou mau puaahorofenua.

mg: Tsy maintsy tany amin'ny morontsiraka avaratr'i Long Island isika, satria teo amin'ny lafiny iray amin'ny trano, dia nandeha niakatra hatrany amin'ny rano ilay lohasaha, izay namirapiratra teo amin'ny iray kilaometatra teo ho eo. Tsy afaka nikarakara ny zavatra rehetra hitako fotsiny aho na teo anelanelan'izany na teo aza. Feno tranobe izay mitovy amin'ny maritrano Grika fahiny ny tontolo manodidina, trano heva an-kalamanjana, trano fanaovana fampisehoana, kianja boribory - afa-tsy ny hoe samy vaovao daholo izy rehetra, ny tsanganan'izy ireo marbra fotsy manjelanjelatra amin'ny masoandro. Tao amin'ny lavaka fasika iray teo akaiky teo, ankizy am-polony avy amin'ny lisea sy satyrs no nilalao volley. Nisidina teo amin'ny farihy kely iray i Canoes. Nifamatotra manodidina ny vondron'ny cabins tao anaty ala ireo ankizy manao T-shirt miloko volomboasary tahaka ny an'i Grover. Ny sasany nitifitra lasibatra teo amin'ny faritra misy ny tsip√¨ka. Ny hafa kosa mitaingina soavaly eny amin'ny lalana iray feno ala, ary raha tsy hoe tsy manao izany aho, dia manana elatra ny sasany amin'ireo soavaliny.

vi_translation: Despite that, I still liked the summer camp; I gradually became attached to the early morning mist covering the beach, the fragrant scent of strawberries every afternoon, and the strange noises echoing from the forest every night. While having a meal at the table of House Number Eleven, pushing a portion of food from the plate into the fire, I tried to find a connection with my biological father. There was nothing except a warm feeling, like the memory of my father's smile.
tr_translation: Despite all this, I had come to love the camp. I had even gotten used to the mist that settled on the beach in the mornings, and the strange monster noises in the grove at night. I ate my meals in cabin eleven, scraped my plate clean and threw it into the fire, trying to communicate with my real father. But nothing was happening. Only that warm feeling that always settled inside me, the memories of my father's smile... I tried not to think about my mother too much, but there was something I wondered: if gods and monsters were real, if all these magical things were possible, then surely there must be a way to save her, to bring her back...
es_translation: Despite everything, I liked the camp. Soon I got used to the morning mist over the beach, the aroma of the strawberry fields in the afternoon, even the strange sounds of the monsters in the woods at night. I dined with those from cabin 11, threw part of my food into the fire, and tried to feel some kind of connection with my real father. I didn't perceive anything, just the warm feeling I had always had, like the memory of his smile. I tried not to think too much about mom, but I kept telling myself: "If gods and monsters are real, if all these magical stories are possible, surely there is a way to save her, to bring her back to life..."

vi_translation: - This is the divine sword. A product made by the hands of the Cyclopes, forged in the heart of Mount Etna and then quenched in the River Lethe. With it, you can kill monsters or any living being in the underworld, as long as they haven't struck first. But the blade will just pass through mortal bodies like an illusion. The simple reason is that mortals are too innocent for the sword to kill. I remind you of one thing: Because you are a demigod, both celestial and mortal weapons can take your life. So you must be doubly careful.
tr_translation: "The sword is made of divine bronze. The Cyclopes forged this sword, it was tempered in the heart of Mount Etna, cooled in the River Lethe. Deadly to monsters, to all creatures of the Underworld; of course, if they don't kill you first. But when it touches mortals, it passes through them like a ghost. Compared to the power of the sword, mortals are insignificant. Let me warn you: since you are a demigod, both divine and normal weapons affect you. You are twice as vulnerable."
es_translation: ‚ÄîThe sword is made of celestial bronze. Forged by the Cyclopes, tempered in the heart of Mount Etna, and cooled in the waters of the River Lethe. It is lethal to monsters and any creature of the underworld, as long as they don't kill you first, of course. However, it passes through mortals like an illusion; they simply aren't important enough for the sword to kill them. Ah!, and I must warn you of one more thing: as a demigod, you can perish by both celestial and normal weapons. You are doubly vulnerable.

vi_translation: Around the circular lake, Cupid statues aimed their bows. I hadn't had time to tell Annabeth to find cover before they released their arrows. But they didn't shoot at us; they shot at each other: The statues on one side shot towards the opposite side of the lake. Thin metal wires followed the arrows and embedded themselves on the other shore, forming a golden star pattern. Then, the tiny metal threads wove themselves together to create a gigantic net.
tr_translation: The Eros statues on the corners began to draw their bows. Before we could shout, "Run, hide," the arrows had already been released from the bows. But we were not the target. They were shooting arrows at each other from the edges of the pool. The thin cables from the arrows arched over the pool and anchored on the opposite side. At the point where the wires met, a large golden star had formed. Then, smaller metal threads also began to mysteriously intertwine, weaving a net. Thin cables were emerging from the arrows, aiming downward over the pool. Where they converged, they formed a huge, golden star. Then, smaller metal pieces also began to mysteriously merge, weaving a web.
es_translation: Above, on the edge, the statues of Cupid drew their bows in shooting position. Without giving us time to take cover, they shot, but not at us, instead at each other, on both sides of the pool. The arrows dragged silky cables that described arcs over the pool and embedded themselves on the edge, forming a huge golden lattice. Then, as if by magic, smaller metallic threads began to weave, intertwining until they formed a net.

vi_translation: But the animal didn't bite; it nestled its snout against me like a house dog. I timidly touched the fish's dorsal fin. It happily wiggled lightly, encouraging me to hold on tighter. I held the fish's fin with both hands. It swam swiftly, pulling me along. If the reader has never ridden a shark, don't try to find a way to do it yourself... However, one must admit that the feeling is more wonderful than any ice skating practice. The shark took me into the dark waters. It dropped me right where the sand at the bottom of the sea sank into a deep abyss. I felt like I was standing on the edge of the Grand Canyon in the dead of night. Even though I couldn't see clearly, I still knew there was a vast, deep chasm below.
tr_translation: But it wasn't attacking me. It was just nudging me with its nose. Like a dog, it wouldn't leave my side. Fearfully, I touched the fin on the shark's back. It pulled back a little, but it seemed to do this so that I would hold on even tighter. I grasped the fin with both of my hands. The shark started to move, pulling me along. It was taking me into the darkness. Then, right at the edge where a huge abyss began, it left me. It was like standing at the edge of the Grand Canyon at midnight. I couldn't see much, but I knew the void was there.
es_translation: But the creature did not attack. It only sniffed me. It followed me like a puppy. It led me into the darkness and deposited me at the very edge of the ocean, where the sandbank plunged into a huge abyss. It was like being on the edge of the Grand Canyon at midnight, not seeing much but aware that the void is right there.

vi_translation: Moving on to another story, mom said she just sold her first life-sized sculpture to a gallery in Soho. Mom's work is titled: Silver Plow. The payment was so substantial that mom had enough money to buy a new apartment and pay for the first year at New York University. The Soho gallery begged mom to sculpt more statues.
tr_translation: Oh, and my mom sold her first sculpture. It was a life-sized piece she called Poker Player. A collector who owns an art gallery in Soho bought the sculpture. My mother made so much money from the sculpture that she used part of it as a deposit to buy a new apartment and paid the first semester's tuition to continue her education at New York University. The art gallery in Soho described my mother's work as a piece pioneering the "super ugly neorealism movement" and was expecting new works from her.
es_translation: In other news, Mom had just sold her first life-size concrete sculpture, titled The Poker Player, to a collector through an art gallery in Soho. She had made so much money that she paid the deposit for a new apartment and the tuition for the first semester at New York University. The Soho gallery had asked for more sculptures, which they described as "a big step towards super-ugly neorealism."

vi_translation: If you intend to stay at the camp year-round, you must report to the Main House before twelve noon today. If you do not report, we will assume that you have either left home or died tragically. When the sun sets, the group of demon bird-men responsible for cleaning will begin their work. They have the right to eat any campers who have not registered. All personal belongings left behind will be cremated in the lava pit.
tr_translation: If you plan to stay at Camp Half-Blood for the entire year, you must inform the Big House by noon today. If you do not report your decision, it will be assumed that you have vacated your cabin or met a terrible fate. The cleaning harpies will start their work at sunset. They are permitted to eat campers who remain in the camp without authorization. All personal belongings will be burned in the lava pit.
